website_summaries.verdict: One of the best USB data hub options from Anker for anyone needing good charging performance.
pros: Dedicated power adapter allows hub to reliably recharge smart devices without noticeable speed issues
Fast data transfer even with multiple devices plugged in
cons: Only 3 ports offer the full USB 3.0 speeds with faster performance than 2.0

customer_reviews.title: Gets VERY hot.
customer_reviews.text: This USB hub gets so hot that it is painful to the touch. It gets hot within a matter of minutes, too, I don't even leave it plugged in because I'm genuinely afraid it's going to start a fire. I want to return it but too much time has passed so I will probably just throw it in the garbage and buy a different USB hub. EDIT: I contacted Anker and they shipped me a new unit immediately. The replacement works perfectly and hasn't generated any heat so far. Hopefully, I just got a bad unit and this replacement will continue to work as intended.
customer_reviews.author: Juggles

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot and USB drives disconnect
customer_reviews.text: Used very, very little over a few years. have been noticing every time I pull a thumb drive out the end is burning hot. I thought it was the drive at first - then I became suspicious of the dock. Tonight doing a large file transfer the drive started disconnecting. Had a new hub (Orico) laying on my desk - plugged my drives into it, started the transfers again and behold everything works perfect and the drive connectors are not burning hot to the touch. Stay away from this product
customer_reviews.author: R. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Constant Failures
customer_reviews.text: Product has compatibility issues with my computer. Connects for a while then turns off. When I plug something into the charging port in slot 7 the hub loses power and stays off until I unplug everything and cycle power to the hub. Really annoying because of how my cables are run. Edit- completely stopped working after 5 uses. Power light flashes then goes dead after plugging it in. Piece of junk.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Chancler

customer_reviews.title: Happy with this product and love this company
customer_reviews.text: I really like Anker products. They are definitely an up and coming company making their mark in the electronics forum. This is probably the 5th Anker product I have purchased and I really trust their products now. This port hub works great. My only small complaint is the one quick charging port on the device is not clearly labeled. I had to go back to the advertisement on Amazon to see which port I should be plugging into to charge my phone faster. It turns out it is port 7 (the last port). Happy with this product and love this company.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Bigsby

customer_reviews.title: Great Device!  Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews, I looked at a few other devices, but I decided to give this one a shot... Let me tell you, I am IMPRESSED! The quality is amazing, and as you can see from the photo I have five devices plugged in and online. The blue lights indicate when a device is actually connected. My devices are across the board from MIDI-over-USB DJ equipment, an two-bay external hard drive array, two external USB drives, and they all work perfectly! The shiny area even comes with a protective cover which I've taken off before taking this picture. The performance through the device is phenomenal as well. I'm definitely buying another one of these for another computer!
customer_reviews.author: Derek Alfonso

customer_reviews.title: Ports stopped being recognized - 7-port hub became 2-port hub.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this USB 3.0 hub about one year. Over the past 4-6 months, the ports started not to be recognized, so a 7-port hub became a 2-port hub. Finally, I gave up on the product and purchased another Aukey powered hub because of my history of success and functionality with that hub. Also, when I had flash drives in the hub, the became almost uncomfortably hot to the touch. Didn't expect that much heating. Flash drive in USB ports on the laptop did not get nearly that hot.
customer_reviews.author: Geebee

customer_reviews.title: this thing is nice.
customer_reviews.text: It only gets three stars, but not because of something Anker necessarily did. It has typical USB 3.0 problems. Interference, data slow downs, wireless peripherals not working. Not sure if any manufacturer can do anything about it, but putting a wireless mouse receiver in this along with a couple USB 3.0 HDDs causes the mouse to basically not work when there is any data transfer on the hard drives. I have had this happen on EVERY USB 3.0 hub I have purchased. It is a documented flaw with USB 3.0. But, this has it so I can't give it more than three stars. Other than that, this thing is nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Lights flickering, not working like intended.
customer_reviews.text: Everything seems grea at first, it's ready to go out of the box, but this hub is frustrating because mine is constantly flickering, and my mouse starts freezing (disconnecting and reconnecting). I've tried all the hubs, its definitely worst on the first two but happens on all of them. Driving me nuts, and I'm bummed because it cost $35! I'm gonna look for some other options, and I'll update the review when I get the chance to compare.
customer_reviews.author: SeattleCirca1981

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for awhile...now malfunctioning
customer_reviews.text: I've had this unit just under one year, and it worked fine until recently, but now it is causing my Windows PC to continually beep with an error "A USB device is malfunctioning." I know its this unit because if I unplug it, the beeping stops. It seems that one of the seven ports has a short in it--I had noticed a few weeks ago that one port wouldn't mount my USB drive any longer but at that point I wasn't worried as I never use all of the seven ports at once. But now, with this infernal beeping, I can't use the unit any longer. Giving 3 stars because when it worked, it worked fine!
customer_reviews.author: World Traveller

customer_reviews.title: Died after 2.5 years of very light use - But I'm buying another one
customer_reviews.text: Welp, this one eventually died. USB hubs are always a bit flaky for some reason. Working in IT and purchasing around 30 of these a year, we have around 80% success rate. I guess that's not too bad. Anker is better than more we've tested. They all eventually die. Not sure if this is a result of the components inside or they need to be cheap in order to sell?
customer_reviews.author: Matthew E.

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work on day 1.
customer_reviews.text: Three of the ports (3,6 & 7) were constantly lit regardless of the fact no device was plugged in or connected. When inserting a standard USB 2.0 thumb drive into the ports, all worked and could read the data, but the lights did not indicate that something was connected. I have good experience with and have enjoyed Anker cables, external batteries, and other hubs like the 4 port adapter but this product especially feels cheep. Returning tomorrow because Amazon makes the process easy. Thank you Amazon. Anker, find a better manufacture for this specific product.
customer_reviews.author: bbqkimchi

customer_reviews.title: short lived
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Dec. 20 2019, Today it failed to connect to my printer for the second time. Lasted six months to the day. I expected better from Anker, I've have good luck with them in the past. Will try another brand, too many others have had the same failure with this hub.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Burch

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have AMPLE outlet space, this will take up 2 spots.
customer_reviews.text: 2 of the devices I needed to route through this were recognized by windows when doing so, this may be the case for any hub so I didn’t dock points for that. The reason I need to return it is bc of the obscenely large power brick for a USB hub. I literally don’t have room for it near any of my outlets (had to unplug speakers to make room to test) so, just fair warning.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: I have had nothing but good experiences with Anker products so I figured I would ...
customer_reviews.text: I've tried a couple of USB 3.0 hubs, but all of them have had a few issues.I have had nothing but good experiences with Anker products so I figured I would give their USB hub a try. This hub worked perfectly for my needs. I was looking for one that was powered and I could place on my desk which is a few feet from the computer. I replaced the USB cord with a longer one so that I could reach my desk and this thing runs like a champ. I have tried it with multiple USB hard drives and flash drives and have yet to have any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Well built, VIA VL812-Q7 based, no EMI shielding
customer_reviews.text: I use it hooked up to a router with 4-5 external 2.5” hard drives that it feeds both data and power. Power delivery seems decent, had no issues with it so far. The hub itself is based on two VIA VL812-Q7 chips, you can also see the power regulators in the images. One thing missing is EMI shielding. The entire haul is made of plastic and provides absolutely no shielding, which is an issue if the device is used in proximity to 2.4GHz Wifi. For that price you would exepect some copper/aluminum tape on the inside at least...
customer_reviews.author: moonwatcher

customer_reviews.title: 3 of the 7 ports failed within a few weeks. Down to 1 half-working port after 4 months of LIGHT use.
customer_reviews.text: Update: 4 months... only 1 port works, and only some of the time. And I only use the hub about once a week. Why is it so hard to make a USB hub that works OK? It's not like this is brand new technology. Downgraded to 1 star. A similar non-Anker hub (by Vantec) died even faster than this Anker one. I'm tempted to disassemble this thing to see why the farthest 3 ports from the power cord end stopped working in under 2 months (with VERY little use), but I think I'll just try the aluminum version. Maybe it's sturdier inside? PS: I've been well pleased with other Anker products, including a non-powered HUB and a wireless mouse.
customer_reviews.author: GeekGuy

customer_reviews.title: Good hub, with a reservation
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like this hub. I got it because I needed a "Powered Hub" as I was going to plug 2 4TB drives into it. I had these lying around and wanted to put them to use. Also I had just gotten an HP Pavilion, a non-internal upgrade-able computer. It turns out 2 drives pushes it's ability. Also the one charging port has a problem, when I plug my phone in it to charge, it does charge but, not at a faster rate of charge than any normal USB-- and Win 10 nags you with "Device plugged in is not mountable" messages.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Adman

customer_reviews.title: Compact hub, but has a large power adapter
customer_reviews.text: Small, and has an LED light for each port that's useful to tell me if I inserted properly. The power adapter is so much larger than the hub itself, and the prongs are aligned vertically on the adapter, so you may not have space on a power-strip if other sockets are occupied which required me to get an extension to make it fit. Even if the devices do not draw power, I need to power this unit to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: John Drake

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my desktop USB hub needs
customer_reviews.text: I previously purchased the Amazon Basics 7 Port USB 3.0 Hub with 12v/3A Power Adapter, but it caused a lot of issues with my peripherals. For example, when I was on video calls, my video camera would just disappear and then reappear. The same was true for the the other peripherals connected to it. So I purchased this one and it has been rock solid. I currently have four peripherals plugged in with room for three more. I don't use it for charging, so no experience good or bad there.
customer_reviews.author: Nick Del Regno

customer_reviews.title: does NOT work with USB 2.0
customer_reviews.text: Doe not work with USB 2.0 (yeah, i know, lots of people are saying "it should" or "it will" but take note those comments do not say "did", are NOT from experience, and are based solely on assumption). I have keyboard and mouse that are usb 2 and neither will work regardless of usb port i use for this hub, yet they will work in every port i plug them into directly. I bought this instead:  the Macally 4 Port Powered USB 2.0 Hub with 5V 2A Power Adapter & 5 foot long Cable .......and both keyboard and mouse worked within 3 seconds with the usb 2 hub.
customer_reviews.author: All American Mall

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly for all my devices!
customer_reviews.text: Great hub for all my USB needs. For my MacBook, which has a measly two USB ports I needed way more connectivity. This unit fit the bill perfectly. I run an external USB drive for backups and this allows me to do so from the hub. I also have numerous other USB devices relying on it including a headset, keyboard and a gigabit Ethernet adapter. It also charges my mobile devices if needed. Quality construction, no drivers or mess, easy setup and just works!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy K.

customer_reviews.title: Just buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Cost me about half of what it costs locally. Packaging was on point and fresh! The hub is super simple to install and use as it’s basically a plug and play system. I regularly run 4+ usb plugs at a time in my laptop for file transferring and storage and this makes the whole process much more efficient now that I only have to use one plug in my laptop while the rest stay powered and connected by the hub. For such a simple product, I couldn’t be more happy!
customer_reviews.author: JCCUSTMZ

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay connected
customer_reviews.text: All the ports came working, but connections are intermittent, particularly for data devices. I have a 1T external SSD and a 64G flash drive, neither of which stays reliably connected. The flash drive initially would not connect at all. Today it connected but was quickly kicked off and would not reconnect. The SSD was better, but today, after having been connected for a few minutes--connect, disconnect, connect, disconnect, and on and on and on. I finally had to disconnect it completely, Other ports are better than those I mentioned here, but at least 3 of the 7 ports do not work properly.
customer_reviews.author: Young Turk

customer_reviews.title: The customer service was great and easy and the replacement works well
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE They honored the warranty and sent me a full working replacement at no cost. The customer service was great and easy and the replacement works well. ------------------------------------------------------------------ I've had this product for 1 year, 5 months. It would normally work over that time, occasionally dropping a device. As of today 4 ports have completely stopped working. 3 ports are still working. It says it comes with an 18 month warranty. Luckily it stopped working at 17 months, hopefully they will replace it. UPDATE They honored the warranty
customer_reviews.author: aaron fallon

customer_reviews.title: or worse, a bag in bubble wrap
customer_reviews.text: I wish more companies paid attention to packaging. For a simple, $30, I was half expecting a box with minimal packaging, or worse, a bag in bubble wrap. This was packed very nicely, with proper bracing, and a well-made (ie, not cheap looking) box with a nice slip cover. Unit itself looks very nice and the fit and finish are flawless. Worked out of box with no fuss and solved the problem I was having with a USB3 addin card in a server with no AUX power cable; connected peripherals (even ones with dedicated external power) were unstable. This hub fixed that. I will update this if anything goes wrong. But at this moment it's 5 star.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Clark

customer_reviews.title: Bought it because I trust Anker products but this product is trash
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my home music studio. Needed a dc powered usb hub to power various usb 3.0 type devices. (Ilok software dongle, Bluetooth, midi keyboard, 1tb toshiba external drive x2, etc.). Not 1 of the possible 7 ports supported data transfer. My computer wouldn’t even recognize the devices when plugged in to the hub. Anker got me as a customer for making rock solid portable batteries, but judging off these reviews and the product I received portable batteries should be all Anker does. Will be returning.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Drew

customer_reviews.title: Reliable HIgh Speed Hub
customer_reviews.text: I have systems that require a large number of usb hard drives to connect. This is the only hub I have tried that consistently keeps these connected. The drives have there own power, so I haven't tired to power a large number of drives from the hub. I have run a couple of USB portable drives off this hub with no problems. This hub solved a problem on one of my systems, so I bought a second hub for use on a laptop that has a couple of broken USB ports. The 7 ports have really helped my connectivity. Anker quality is hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne W

customer_reviews.title: gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 disks (2 HDD, one SSD) plugged in, a keyboard, headset and mouse. It seems happy with all that. It also charges my iphone, but not as quickly as a dedicated charger seems to. I got this to detangle things - I move my laptop around a lot and unplugging 1 cable is easier than unplugging 6. While I do think it's overpriced, and it's a bit obnoxious that they used a custom plug to join it to the cable (-1 star for that). I think it will do.
customer_reviews.author: S. Mayo

customer_reviews.title: 18 Month Hassle Free Return Policy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product 19 months ago. Naturally after the 18 month hassle free return policy expired, so to did this hub. I had a Belkin that lasted over 10 years. I will not buy this item or any product from Anker again. After writing this review, Anker contacted me and sent me a new one, which I am happy to say it arrived post haste and is working. I hope this one lasts at least as long as the broken one. That being said I am changing my rating to 4 stars. Thank you Anker!
customer_reviews.author: Yancx

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent power cycles kill backups.
customer_reviews.text: I'm generally a big fan of Anker, I've got several other of their hubs, desk light, phone battery backup, etc. I've had two of this specific model that within a few weeks it intermittently power cycles and all connected devices disconnect, this is particularly bad when it happens during a disk backup. I've switched it to my APC to ensure it's getting consistent power, no change. UPDATE: Anker is replacing the unit and I have high hopes that I'll be able to change my rating on this, as I'm generally a big fan of their products. Still hasn't arrived though mail service in my neighborhood is seriously slow so I'm not surprised.
customer_reviews.author: Reverend Matt

customer_reviews.title: Anker is my trump card
customer_reviews.text: Every time I purchase an Anker product, I always smile when it arrives. Not only do they make high-quality products, but the care they take in packaging them is always evident. I've never had bad luck with one of their products, and so when I'm looking for something I always first check to see if they make one. This USB hub is no exception - clean and simple design, works great, and reasonably priced.
customer_reviews.author: Toby Ovod-Everett

customer_reviews.title: Dies one port at a time
customer_reviews.text: I just entered my 4th month of use and the unit seems to be dying, 1 port at a time. I run a pair of 3gb, powered hard drives, and two USB mouse/keyboard transmitters and then hot swap out numerous thumb drives, SSD drives etc. The 36w of power appears too low to support all that I am throwing at it. The thing I dislike the most is that it never stays face up on my desk. I needed to attach some velcro strips to keep it port side up on my desktop.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Browne

customer_reviews.title: Works Fine But USB Cable Too Short
customer_reviews.text: Well I hooked it up and I'm running three external hard drives off it and they seem to be running fine. Haven't moved any files yet, but I assume things will be a lot faster, since I had two of the hard drives plugged into 2.0 USB slots. My only complaint is the USB cable they give you is too damn short. I had to put all my hard drives and the hub on the on the floor next to each other, because the USB cable wouldn't reach from the USB slot on the computer to the top of the desk. Cable is only maybe 18 inches long. Charge a couple dollars more and provide a three foot cable.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Young

customer_reviews.title: Dead Within 30 Days-Updated
customer_reviews.text: Update: 7/4/2019-Anker sent me a working replacement immediately. They were very quick to help with the problem. I bought this product based on mostly positive reviews, but I DID read a few negative ones that shared my problem with this product. It barely lasted 30 days, it's dead. I tried unplugging the power source, unplugging it from computer, several reboots, etc., but it's dead. I bought this to replace a hub that lasted 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: Holyforge

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, More accessible usb3.0 ports on my desktop
customer_reviews.text: Works just how I wanted it to. USB cord is a tad short, but long enough to reach the only 3.0 ports in the rear of my desktop. Charges my HTC M8 super fast. No significant variations in transfer speeds when using this hub vs directly connecting a device to USB3.0 port. Good quality look/feel. small footprint. Very happy with this purchase. Your cord matters, especially if you want to use the super fast charge. Invest in a good cable, bad cables cause a number of issues and can damage devices
customer_reviews.author: J. A. W. John

customer_reviews.title: Good Hub
customer_reviews.text: I use this as a hub for 3 external HDDs for my Xbox One. I needed a powered one because a regular one wouldn't provide the power. It powers the 3 I have hooked up easily and because of its design, allows them to sit easily on to of my Xbox One X with no issues. The connection isn't slow or anything else and I have zero issues with my purchase. I only use 3 external ones because that is all Xbox will support.
customer_reviews.author: Nero

customer_reviews.title: So if you plan to use it as a network unit you'd better have a second thought
customer_reviews.text: The hub is very well done and works with the vast variety of equipment. I've successfully tested it with 3 seagate external hard drives and think it can accommodate more (as long as they have their own power supply). My laptops and tablets can see the drives plugged into the hub without any problem. Unfortunately it does not work with my Asus rt-ac56 router (I bought it specifically to this end). So if you plan to use it as a network unit you'd better have a second thought.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong 2.25 years later
customer_reviews.text: I bought this back on Sept 3 2017, it's been powered up ever since, and is still doing what I ask of it. Rapid Charging my Samsung Note5 and acting as a hub. The only 'drawback' I can mention is it is not rec'd(by my experience) to have a Logitech KB/Mouse dongle plugged into it. Probably any kb/mouse dongle. It, the dongle thus your KB/mouse, coughs and chokes upon inserting a memory stick. Overall I'm very please with my purchase. Still.
customer_reviews.author: Not so Sweet Sue

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 4 years of sporadic use
customer_reviews.text: For anyone who’d like to know, we used this sporadically over the last 4 years and it has died. I personally thought it would last longer than this. I’ve used many different Anker products before and been satisfied with them, but not blown away. Please let me know if anyone has any recommendations of a better usb hub or brand to check out :) Thanks to everyone for your reviews! And happy shopping!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. Z

customer_reviews.title: So SMALL!
customer_reviews.text: This hub replaced a 5+ year old Anker 7 port USB3.0 hub that finally failed. The new one is more powerful and has a charging port which the old one didn't have AND is about 1/4 the size, approximately 1" wide x 1" deep x 4" high. Because of where it is mounted, I don't use the charging portion. It is used to connect 3 external drives, a USB extension cable that comes up to my desktop, and a USB3 card reader. Well done, Anker!
customer_reviews.author: Henry W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent USB Hub.
customer_reviews.text: I tested the data transfer rates with 40GB of data moving it from External USB drive, through this hub to another attached external USB drive. Typically, even USB3, normal hubs take hours to transfer this much data. This hub enabled that transfer to run in well under 1 hour. As a long time IT guy, this impressed me. If I need another usb hub, this will be my choice. The product is small, convenient, and very fast.
customer_reviews.author: biouxtai

customer_reviews.title: Perfect add on for USB 3 ports
customer_reviews.text: I use two of these for a couple of my computers. And I've had one now for over 9 months with no issues at all. The added power supply helps ensure you don't pull power from your motherboard as that is very limiting. While I do wish PC's offered enough ports for all the peripherals I use this Anker adapter is one of the best add-ons I've used. Have always been an Anker fan.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Rea

customer_reviews.title: Caused my external hard drive to fail
customer_reviews.text: As you can never have enough USB ports on your laptop, I bought this hub. I used it to connect two external hard drives, and it seemed to work well. However, the hub kept cutting off the connection to the hard drives, and this has the same effect as pulling out the cable without disconnection the hard drive first. So after a while, this caused one of the hard drives to fail. Maybe the hub can be used for connecting a mouse or a keyboard, but be careful if you connect more sensitive items. Update: After leaving the review above, I was contacted by Anker customer service, and they gave me a full refund for the hub. Great customer service!
customer_reviews.author: F. Knoph

customer_reviews.title: Works great, incredible customer service.
customer_reviews.text: I had a technical issue, and indicated so in my review. Customer service quickly reached out and replaced it. The new one works perfectly. I am satisfied with the properly working product, and very satisfied with the incredible customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Mostly works
customer_reviews.text: Mostly works, I could be overestimating what even a powered usb hub can do. My external hard drive doesn't automatically turn on but it works, my external DVD player for sure takes longer, and my Logitech mouse doesn't work on this (well only when my eyes are crossed and I am sitting right up on the hub). Next time I should look for something with more power? Maybe I don't know it might have to be expensive like a docking station, but they hardly have more ports then a laptop.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: DEAD within 2 weeks of actual use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item in December for future use. After two weeks of actual use this month..it's DEAD AS A DOOR NAIL. The Exact same one I purchased a few year ago is still going strong....Bad quality control. Customer Service however is great and is sending a replacement within the week....so 5 stars because of that and I own another of these that has lasted over 2 years without a problem.
customer_reviews.author: James G.

customer_reviews.title: Worked at first and now won't charge anything
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED: the Anker team reached out about my review and went above and beyond to make it right. They sent me a new product that more effectively fulfils my needs as a user and I am happy with the charger and service! This worked great the first 2 or 3 times I used it, but now it won't charge at all from any port. My phone links to it and the battery charge symbol appears, but the battery still progressively drains with absolutely zero recharge. Super disappointed because this is a useful concept for my station at work.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Van Tassel

customer_reviews.title: Great device. I've been converting old Dell servers to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great device. I've been converting old Dell servers to high end Linux desktops. The servers were never intended to drive the wealth of high powered USB devices, but using the various Anker powered USB hubs seems to resolve these issues well. If you have devices that need charging [no data transfer], I'd recommend getting one of the hubs with the PowerIQ ports as these don't even try ot connect to the host computer. Great for cell phones, bluetooth headsets etc...
customer_reviews.author: -jmg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Hub!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent hub - I have used with several different USB sticks and external hard-drives including SSD types. Crystal Diskmark measured throughput through the hub with a fast external SSD was as good as with direct connect to the main board. Works great with phones for charging and data transfer. The supplied USB cable is long enough to reach the rear panel on my mid tower with the hub on the top front. Plenty of power for several devices simultaneously. All and all an excellent device. Not a surprise after using other products from Anker. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: THIS HUB IS A BEAST! I'M POWERED UP!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe the power that this hub has! I have 2 different 4 tb external drives hooked up, an external dvd player/burner, a bluetooth dongle, the dongle for my wireless mouse and a 26800 mah power bank charging. No lag on anything. I thought that I needed the 10 port hub or larger hub that they sell for this much power but no. I waited months to write this review to see if this hub could power these devices without failure. Not one problem. 5 stars all day!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kim Adams

customer_reviews.title: It works, but it's not the light of mi life.
customer_reviews.text: It works, but I purchased it because it didn't have lighted switches. I didn't know it still had lights. My computer is in my bedroom, and it's constantly on, but the monitors sleep as I do. The hum=b does NOT! I had to mask the indicator lights, but that didn't stop the light from shining out around the USB ports, even when plugged. I don't need that keeping me awake! I have to remember to cover it with a thick cloth before I go to bed. Not my preferred solution.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: Like most anker products it feels nice
customer_reviews.text: I like it just fine. It would be better with some power switches and a more compact power adapter. Seriously the power adapter is huge and the only way I can plug it in is by blocking the power button on the power strip, which also means accidentally hitting the power button if I bump it. Considering getting some tiny extension cords to solve problem devices such as this. Honestly I have not really tried the charging port so I cannot comment on that.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: What was Anker thinking?
customer_reviews.text: The hub its self works well but when placed on my desk with the power cord and USB cable in the rear of the hub facing the wall where the outlet is, the inserted flash drive's LED light indicator is facing backwards toward the wall making it impossible to monitor the flash drives activity. This hub would have received 5 stars if not for this important oversite.
customer_reviews.author: Jim466

customer_reviews.title: Failed
customer_reviews.text: Bought it in July. It started failing in September. I plugged my microphone and camera into this USB hub and then plugged that into a USB port. It intermittently cuts out. I can hear the computer beep as the drop happens. The blue lights go off on the hub. When I plug the mike and camera directly into the computer I have no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Ira Hart

customer_reviews.title: Really like the port layout.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to upgrade my USB-1 hub and this one has been working well for three months now. So far I have only used it for keyboard and mouse to my laptop and have not had a chance to use it for any high data applications. I especially like the slim profile with all USB ports lined up in a single row and the power port on the narrow end which makes it easy to keep between my laptop monitor and wall without really losing any desk space. For that feature alone I give it a five star.
customer_reviews.author: William Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I started making ammunition reloading videos and needed more USB ports. I found however that I can only use one camera at a time per USB port, including the 12 that my computer has. As long as I keep the cams on separate ports I have no conflicts. I use one of these powered ports in my office as well as for making production films with a high load of external accessories.
customer_reviews.author: J. A.

customer_reviews.title: Don't change cords like a sucker get the 10 port. GREAT product though that works flawlessly and the two powered ports are great
customer_reviews.text: So if you take a look at my reviews you will see a review for another Anker 7 port hub with power that did not have a removable cord and it was SOOOO short I found it unusable (if you're looking for this feature aka a hub to throw in your bag it may be great). This was the replacement and I love it. I should have got the 10 port because you want to plug in everything so you aren't changing cords out every two minutes (okay once a week or so) like a sucker.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin K.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: A great powered hub that works well with Mac!
customer_reviews.text: I use it every day with my Macbook Pro and love it! I kept having hard drives just eject from my Macbook Pro and it was driving me crazy. So I decided to purchase this powered hub. Problem solved. My hard drives all work great with this! I normally have every USB slot on this hub filled all the time! I have used it for over a year now, with zero issues! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jay Malone

customer_reviews.title: nothing but great things to say
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about buying one of these vs. a Juiced model and ended up going with this based on the reviews. So far, nothing but great things to say, and it fits my needs excellent. My only minor complaint is that the blue LED lights are a bit bright in low light working conditions but it's not a deal breaker for me. I actually keep this laying on the side, I find it's less strain on the USB cables and makes cable management that much easier for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: I Got a Lemon
customer_reviews.text: The Anker 7-Port USB 3.0 Data Hub I received was dead on arrival & installation. Maybe the device I received was a "lemon" & not representative of the norm of this product, but I didn't have the patience to get it replaced by another one of the same model. I ended up buying a different model from another company.
customer_reviews.author: Shadowfax

customer_reviews.title: Very big power adapter....
customer_reviews.text: Great for getting a lot more of ports on a laptop, currently on a UX305CA that I'm using as a desktop, however, the wall power adapter is very big! I chose this model because the next one in capacity (10 ports) requires a brick power adapter, but this one requires a lot of space in the power strip. Come on Anker, you make very great travel USB chargers, you can come with something smaller for these kind of devices. Why not to use just a single power cable to the unit and have the power conversion there? You have the technology to do that! ;)
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: It was a miss for me & my Mac
customer_reviews.text: This has compatibility issues with my 2015 MacBook 13". I don't seem to get 100% compatibility with my iPhone, Logitech Mouse and Logitech Keyboard. Everything lags. Everything works great once connected directly to the MacBook. Everything is problematic once connected to the hub.
customer_reviews.author: Paulmoh

customer_reviews.title: Seems Great
customer_reviews.text: Working fine for me. If you get a bad one like some people say they do just exchange it. Also keep in mind that you should always run your equipment through battery back up units. These backup units will ensure that your devices are getting clean electricity to fragile devices. Little and cheap devices like this will not tolerate dirty current well when plugged directly into your wall socket.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Bombadil

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, no problems yet.
customer_reviews.text: As I would expect from a USB hub, this was really easy to install, and works perfectly so far. No noticeable lag on connected devices yet, and my Note 5 charges just fine on the charging port (which actually connects to the computer too, which I believe someone said it doesn't). I would rather the charging port not connect to my computer, but that's just what I hope for, where many others may wish otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good USB hub, not flawless
customer_reviews.text: Decent USB hub, but has issues with HDMI/USB KVM switch. When switching between inputs, some devices come back up and are accessible, (ex: keyboard, USB stick) but at times, others do not (ex: mouse, USB headset). Switching back to a source and back again sometimes fixes, otherwise requires disconnect from the USB root and plugging back in. Probably not an issue for most people, which otherwise works really well for charging and power.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Carver

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, ports stop working
customer_reviews.text: Anker is usually good but after a couple of months, two of the USB ports failed on this hub, and then slowly after more ports failed. As of this writing (another port has failed) bring this hub down to 2 working ports out of the 7. Basically, after unplugging a usb device, the port will stop working. Printers, card readers, USB drives. All the devices work, but this hub is very poor quality in the short or long term.
customer_reviews.author: sshan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with some devices
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hub for use with my 2018 Mac mini and the hub does not work well. It does not work at all with my Epson USB-powered scanner and it works only intermittently with an external DVD writer. Both the scanner and DVD writer work fine when plugged into the USB hub that is a part of my Dell monitor. The Anker hub does work with flash drives, but I don't need a powered hub for that.
customer_reviews.author: Kaibob

customer_reviews.title: Great hub, but very big power adapter plug
customer_reviews.text: This hub is really great. It's small, so it can fit basically anywhere you need it to. The build quality is very good, and everything works flawlessly so far. The indicator lights allow you to quickly see which devices are connected correctly, or which device(s) may be having an issue. My only criticism is that this hub comes with an enormous power plug. The plug is basically the size of the hub itself. This was a bit annoying, since I have limited space around my power strip/wall outlet. While it was a minor issue for me, it may not matter for people with other setups. Were the plug smaller and more compact, this would be a 5-star review for me.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan from Iowa

customer_reviews.title: works, but with issues
customer_reviews.text: This powered hub works well most of the time, but with major issues. If I have one hard drive plugged in to the hub, connected to my Macbook Pro, and I plug in another hard drive, the first one will eject. This has happened with several different drives, so this issue is the hub. I just have to make sure no data is transferring if I want to plug in a new drive. Don't use this for professional purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Looks good on my desk Cons: - With my USB 3.0 flash drive plugged in, all other devices on the hub stop working. (doesn't happen with other hubs) - Resuming computer from standby shows the hub drawing more power than my computer can supply (and thus the hub stop working until I unplug the hub AND its power supply to reboot the hub) - Simply stopped working after 3 months no matter what I do.
customer_reviews.author: Dory

customer_reviews.title: Loses power over a few weeks
customer_reviews.text: I'll give you the lo-down: it worked fantastically for the first 3 weeks. Every slot was powered and functioned as it should. After 3 weeks, the slots began to lose power individually. Now the only slots that work on my unit are the ones my keyboard and mouse are plugged into. The 3rd slot registers when something is plugged in but for whatever reason, the hub isn't drawing enough power to make what's plugged into the slot function despite the fact the hub is plugged directly into my power strip. I've tried all the usual fixes: unplugged and plugged it back in, cleaned the ports, restarted my PC, etc. Nothing worked. In conclusion, buy something from Sabrent instead.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Great Hub but Doesn't Work Passively
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product because I keep my computer in a different room. I currently have a webcam, Blue Yeti microphone, keyboard and mouse connected and it works great. I was a bit disappointed that it doesn't work unless it's plugged in via the 12V adapter. The cord on it is only about 3 feet long (maybe shorter) and makes for some placement issues. I was also looking to have less wires and now I'm running the USB and power cables.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Not all ports work the same
customer_reviews.text: This unit has 7 ports, I only have 4 devices plugged into it, and only 2 of them draw power from this hub. The other two have their own power source. But I can not use all 4 devices. Sometimes I can plug them into different ports but it only seem to last for a while. the bottom line is that it is unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: PxZ

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I have purchased several Anker products over the years and have been very pleased. I purchased this device about 3 months ago, used it maybe 3 times, and now it doesn't work at all. I've tried other devices in the computer port, everything is fine. I've tried every port in the device, not one works with any of the (simple) devices I've plugged in. Extremely disappointed. Poor product that jeopardizes Ankers name, one I've grown to trust. I do not recommend buying this device.
customer_reviews.author: Randall

customer_reviews.title: NOT RECOMMENDED for the price point
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced. I purchased 4, one for each computer. 2 died within 8 months, the other two died within 14 month. A USB hub is not a complicated device, at this price point they should work more than 12 months,. NOT RECOMMENDED for the price point. Find a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Deez

customer_reviews.title: Works Well on Macbook Pro (Late 2013)
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this with my Macbook Pro Laptop for awhile now and it works exactly as it is supposed to work. I can recommend you get one of these if you have a Macbook Pro Laptop (late 2013). Considering Mac is dropping USB on their new laptops then if you are like me and need many USB connections then one of these would be good assuming it still works with the necessary required adapter.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Don't know how I functioned without it!
customer_reviews.text: Great item - super handy, fairly priced, performs well. I bought six of these - four for at work, and two for at home. At the shops, these USB data hubs keep all peripherals working smoothly and concurrently. At home, they make the USB ports accessible to me on top of my desk - no more rooting around and contorting myself to plug in my headphones or phone to charge. Thanks, Anker - and btw, the packaging is beautifully unassuming and precise.
customer_reviews.author: B. Michlig

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: I needed to connect more than one external HD at once to my laptop and this does the trick. For some reason, it hates the little dongle for my mouse so I have a hard time using anything but my laptop's crappy trackpad with this hub but otherwise the hub is great. No problems connecting my HDs whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Ray2332

customer_reviews.title: I bought this on Nov 3rd last year (8 months ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on Nov 3rd last year (8 months ago) and just now tried it out. IT DOESN'T WORK! I tried it on 3 different computers (one running Linux, and two running Windows7) and it didn't work on any of them. Is it too late to return this item? Obviously the box it came in is long gone.
customer_reviews.author: JCM

customer_reviews.title: Quality build with rock solid performance
customer_reviews.text: It's an Anker:. To me it is a synonym for reliability and quality and value. I've bought many accessories through the years, it pays to buy Anker. The only Anker product I ever had trouble with, they replaced immediately AND without requiring me to return the failed product. Class act.
customer_reviews.author: No Drama PLZ

customer_reviews.title: High quality USB Hub!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this USB hub for just a bit over 2 months now and have had zero issues the entire time. I use this with a MIDI keyboard, a Novation Launchpad, a Buetooth mouse/keyboard receive and to charge my phone. I love the phone charging feature since USB is typically slow charging and this helps me save an outlet on my power strip. I would highly recommend Anker, this product and others of theirs. I've put a ton of use into this USB hub with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Ralph

customer_reviews.title: Be careful of poor quality! I've only had this product for 7 ...
customer_reviews.text: Be careful of poor quality! I've only had this product for 7 months and it's already had issues. In the last few months, the fast charge was working intermittently. Also seemed like it wasn't charging that fast compared to if I were to plug it into an outlet. 7 months later, it's completely stopped working. Not only that, the port above it stopped working as well. Cables have no problem, I tried it on a brick to confirm. Oddly enough the other ports are still working.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Product does not operate as it reads
customer_reviews.text: I bought 4 of these for office and field use for our company and it does not charge 6 devices at one time. I can barely get it to work, sometimes. it impacts the computer usb ports. I have to restart the computer because its drawing to much power. the plug part apparently does not work as well as it advertises. I would not buy this product again and would advise others not to buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony B. Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Good hub and better customer service
customer_reviews.text: At first, I was going to give this a poor review due to the first hub I was sent having a short of some kind that caused my litUSB keyboard to constantly flicker. However, Anker's support people were very quick to identify it as a faulty hub and sent me a replacement, which works fine. So, great customer service! As for the hub itself, it's power brick is too bulky to consider the hub as a portable option. However, it works extremely well as a desktop hub. The replacement hub has worked smoothly since it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Dwight

customer_reviews.title: Short Connector Cable
customer_reviews.text: the USB 3.0 Data cable is only 2.6ft long, which unless you are just leaving on top of your computer, is much too short to travel from a tower under your desk to the top of your desk. My buddy uses this one at his house and it works well, I just didn't know he had gotten an extra long cable for it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I've been having a heck of a time with USB Hubs and my peripherals lately. My cheap little 4-port hub worked fine for a couple years, but these things don't last forever. When I tried another similar one, it just couldn't handle the load at all. This product has definitely answered all my needs. The power adapter has solved all those problems, and the cord is long enough to reach the wall socket (which I could not say for the last one I tried). Haven't had any more issues since I started using this hub. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: S. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Bought this to use with my raspberry pi 3, ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my raspberry pi 3, it powers it but I was unable to get any USB devices to work. I attempted to use a mini wireless keyboard, a USB arcade controller and an xbox wires controller - none worked I'm sure this will work on a PC though. UPDATE: Anker customer support reached out to me and confirmed that this will not work with the Pi well. They were nice enough to give me the option of a full refund without having to return the hub! Changed from 3 stars to 5 stars for excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo & Kayla

customer_reviews.title: No fast charging
customer_reviews.text: All of the ports charge extremely slowly, even the dedicated charging port. I was expecting my GS8 to fast charge since this plugs directly I to an AC outlet. My Kindle Fire 8 charges painfully slowly - several hours to top off from 70%. Maybe I have a defective unit. I'll reach out to Anker and see what they think and update my review but for now this is simply an expensive basic USB hub.
customer_reviews.author: Joel T. Bell

customer_reviews.title: Better than I could have hoped
customer_reviews.text: I use this device for adding usb ports to my ps4. I haven't tried using it for charging yet, but I currently have the following devices connected and working simultaneously; Seagate 2TB hard drive SanDisk 64GB flash drive Logitech wireless keyboard and mouse combo I tried these devices in all ports to make sure they all worked and had no issues with any device. I have only had this device for 2 weeks at this point. If this changes I will update with info about what changed.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M

customer_reviews.title: Could be ok if you don't need to charge iPads and such.
customer_reviews.text: Does not charge iPad and iPhone at same time, despite having confirmed with the company that it would do so. Returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jim G

customer_reviews.title: Good Idea - Bad Execution, loose connections.
customer_reviews.text: The drive USB wire is very short, not to be used for a desktop. The USB connector to the device is loose and there is a constant mount and unmount with just barely touching anything the device gets disconnected and then reconnects -- Loose Wire connection, very short wire perhaps good for laptop, but NOT for desktop / desk environment.
customer_reviews.author: Austin Review

customer_reviews.title: there isn't enough power in the hub to power my external usb dvd super drive attached to my mid 2015 macbook pro
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, there isn't enough power in the hub to power my external usb dvd super drive attached to my mid 2015 macbook pro.The Super drive works well when plugged directly into the mac's usb port. Everything else works ( Thumb drives and my usb bluetooth receiver for my mouse). I bought this specifically for the super drive... Searching for another hub with more power☹️
customer_reviews.author: Mikee

customer_reviews.title: good product and super great service
customer_reviews.text: bought two units for all my toys one unit stopped working properly and i contact anker support their customer support shipped a replacement and it traveled from Kentucky to Delaware in one day (wow) Super great service and extremely good product will be buying more for my Windows 10 system real-soon-now Even got a follow up email on a Sunday to make sure it had been delivered and was working..
customer_reviews.author: James A. Sterling III

customer_reviews.title: Crashed my computer twice. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: BEWARE! I plugged this into my computer and it crashed my computer. I had to re-install Windows from scratch, none of the recovery or restore options worked. I wasn't 100% this was the culprit, so after I re-installed everything I tried using this device again and the same thing happened. I'm currently re-installing Windows for the second time in two days and it's extraordinarily frustrating. I'm getting a refund, but I still lost two days because of this product. I wish there was a world where I could get compensated for that.
customer_reviews.author: RW

customer_reviews.title: Excellent powered USB hub!
customer_reviews.text: I am pleasantly surprised with this powered hub. I needed to add more USB 3.0 ports to my wife's NUC, but wanted a powered hub to handle an external DVD-R. The black, glossy look matches nicely with her monitors and desktop peripherals, which was an unexpected plus. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: KARL LEWIS

customer_reviews.title: Great little hub.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. I can fill all the ports with various USB 3.0 and 2.0 devices and they all instantly appear in Windows File Explorer. The hub must be powered by the AC adapter to work. It will not work on USB power alone. There is one green LED at the corded end of the device that glows dimly when the power adapter is plugged in. Each port has an individual blue LED that lights up when a device is plugged in and active. These are also dim and unobtrusive. The unit is small and takes up little room on your desk. As long as you have room to plug in the power adapter, this is a great expansion hub.
customer_reviews.author: KW

customer_reviews.title: Works with Raspberry Pi 4
customer_reviews.text: This device works with the pi4, it allows you to reboot with SSD’d plugged in (some cheap hubs don’t). I have 1 NVME and 2 SATA M2 SSD’s in unpowered usb enclosures and this hub is doing great. If you are building a NAS or just a pi4 with big storage, this is the one to get!
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Baker makes great value products
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t support the Apple USB SuperDrive but I haven’t run across one that does. This is a solid usb hub...it has some gravity to it so it stays planted firmly on my desk. I have a sit/stand desk and it came with plenty of cable for both extremes of the desk. I also really like having the higher power USB socket for charging...that was a nice plus.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good solution if you need extra USB ports
customer_reviews.text: My new, thin, light laptop arrived with a USB C port and two USB 3.0 ports, insufficient for the many things that I seem to need - printers, mice, external drives and so on. The Anker USB 3.0 port hub got good online reviews and it does the job nicely with 7 USB 3.0 ports, one with (BC 1.2), 2-amp charging and the other six with 0.9-amp charging, power supply and a sturdy USB 3.0 connecting cable with its own port. The hub is small, unobtrusive and nicely finished. It reduces cable clutter from the sides of a laptop. If you need a bunch of USB ports, the Anker is a good solution.
customer_reviews.author: Harry Vonk

customer_reviews.title: Small, elegant, efficient-looking USB hub.
customer_reviews.text: So far it seems to be working well. It feels solid yet is much smaller than I expected and doesn't take up a lot of space on my desk. All the ports point upwards so they're easy to access. The one thing it won't work well for is my Polar pulse monitor which needs a lot of space, but other than that, it seems great.
customer_reviews.author: NYC buyer

product_meta.title: Anker 7-Port USB 3.0 Data Hub with 36W Power Adapter and BC 1.2 Charging Port for iPhone 7/6s Plus, iPad Air 2, Galaxy S Series, Note Series, Mac, PC, USB Flash Drives and More
product_meta.description: Anker 7-Port USB 3. 0 Data Hub Expand and accelerate your data transfer and charging. Ultra-Compact Small, lightweight design provides greater portability and conserves space when connecting multiple devices. Upward-facing ports enable effortless, one-handed plugging. 7 High-Speed Data Ports Instantly add 7 USB 3. 0 SuperSpeed ports to your PC and enjoy data transfer rates of up to 5Gbps. Fast Charging The dual functionality of the 7th port enables data transfer while still providing a full 1. 5A charging speed. (Ensure that the power adapter is connected and plugged in. ) Devices Requirements Notes: Apple: iPhone 5 / 5s, iPad Air, iPad mini / mini 2 Samsung: Galaxy S2 / S3 / S4, Galaxy Note 1 / 2, Galaxy Mega, Galaxy Mini, Exhilarate, Galaxy Tab 2 10. 1 Google: Nexus 4 / 5 / 7 / 10 Sony: Xperia TX Nokia: Lumia 920, Lumia 1020 System Requirements Notes: Compatible with Mac OS X (10. 2 and above). OS X Lion 10. 7. 4 users should upgrade to Mountain Lion 10. 8. 2 or later to avoid unstable connection. Additional Notes: Some USB 3. 0 devices require direction connection to host ports. 2. 4 Ghz wireless devices (keyboards, mice, etc. ) may not work around USB 3. 0 ports. Try using a USB 2. 0 connection. The non-charging ports are intended for data transfer only. They provide insufficient power output for charging. Ensure that the adapter is connected before using this hub.
feature_bullets: Compact palm-sized grip (4.3 × 1.7 × 0.9in) and lightweight design (2.9oz).
Easily add 7 USB 3.0 SuperSpeed ports to your PC and enjoy data transfer rates of up to 5Gbps for faster sync times. Backward compatible with USB 2.0 / 1.1.
7th data port also delivers BC 1.2 charging speeds of up to 2.1 amps , while the other 6 ports charge at speeds of up to 0.5A each, with 5.1 amps overall among 7 ports.

High-grade chipset and 36 watt adapter guarantee steady operation. Supports plug-and-play and hot-swapping. No installation of drivers required for Windows XP / Vista / 7 / 8 / 10 or Mac OS X 10.2 and above.
Package contents: Anker USB 3.0 7-Port Hub, 12V / 3A power adapter, 2.6-foot USB 3.0 cable, welcome guide, 18-month hassle-free warranty.

specifications.Operating System: MacOS 10.12 Sierra, Windows XP, Windows Vista, Windows 8, Mac OS X 10.2 Jaguar, Windows 7, Windows 10
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars3,202 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
